description: Wary suspicion: attention narrows into interpretive vigilance—reading tone, timing, and inconsistencies. Not panic, not scanning-for-immediate-danger; it's a cautious, skeptical tracking that keeps options open.
actor_description: Something doesn't line up, and my mind stops giving the benefit of the doubt. I feel myself measuring—pauses, phrasing, little mismatches—like I'm assembling a quiet pattern in the background. My body stays mostly steady, but my attention keeps returning to it, sharpening around what I can't quite name. I'm not afraid enough to bolt; I'm just not willing to relax.
description_text: {actor} goes watchful and guarded—eyes lingering a beat too long, expression tightening into a skeptical neutrality. Their attention keeps circling the same details, as if weighing what's being said against what isn't.

prerequisites.failure_message: Requires suspicion with engaged tracking and moderate threat plus cool/low affiliation. Excludes panic/terror and high hypervigilance so it stays interpretive distrust (not alarm). Caps anxiety/dread and blocks fatigue/numbness so it doesn't fire as low-energy rumination. Triggers only on a suspicion spike, a threat uptick, or a threshold crossing.

alternate_descriptions.auditory: I hear {actor}'s voice flatten slightly—shorter answers, fewer fillers—like they've switched to careful wording. Their breathing stays controlled, but the pauses get more deliberate, as if they're choosing what to reveal.
alternate_descriptions.tactile: {actor}'s presence feels edged but contained: posture a touch more rigid, movements economical, hands less expressive. It's the sensation of someone holding space open around themselves, ready to step back without making a scene.
alternate_descriptions.limited: {actor} looks guarded and watchful, attention repeatedly returning to the same details.
